contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{pp-semi-indef}}{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> Image:Catherine Parr from NPG cropped.jpg|Catherine Parr File:LambethBridge.jpg|Lambeth Bridge File:Bundesarchiv Bild 101I-219-0553A-36, Russland, bei Pokrowka, russischer Panzer T34.jpg|An abandoned Soviet T-34 tank at Prokhorovka File:Medal of honor old.jpg|Medal of Honor from years 1862 to 1895 File:Congmedalhonor.jpg|Congressional Medal of Honor File:Australian Aboriginal Flag.svg|Australian Aboriginal flag </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | [[1580]] – The '''[[Ostrog Bible]]''', the first [[Bible]] in [[Old Church Slavonic]], was printed in [[Ostroh]], Ukraine, by [[Ivan Fyodorov (printer)|Ivan Fyodorov]]. | no citations at all |- | [[1690]] – [[Williamite]] forces defeated [[Jacobitism|Jacobite]] troops at the '''[[Battle of the Boyne]]''' just outside [[Drogheda]], Ireland, marking a turning point in the [[Williamite War in Ireland|Williamite War]]. | refimprove, original research |- | [[1790]] – The '''[[Civil Constitution of the Clergy]]''' was passed, a law that subordinated the [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholic Church]] in France to the French government. |needs more footnotes |- | [[1806]] – Sixteen [[List of states in the Holy Roman Empire|German states]] left the [[Holy Roman Empire]] and formed the '''[[Confederation of the Rhine]]'''. | needs more footnotes |- |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[927]] – '''[[Æthelstan]]''', [[List of English monarchs|King of England]], secured a pledge from [[Constantine II of Scotland|Constantine II of Scotland]] that the latter would not ally with [[Viking]] kings. {{*mp}} [[1543]] – [[Henry VIII of England|King Henry VIII of England]] married '''[[Catherine Parr]]''', his [[Wives of Henry VIII|sixth and last wife]], at [[Hampton Court Palace]]. {{*mp}} [[1843]] – [[Joseph Smith, Jr.]], founder of the [[Latter Day Saint movement]], '''[[Origin of Latter Day Saint polygamy|proclaimed a revelation]]''' recommending [[Mormonism and polygamy|polygamy]]. {{*mp}} [[1862]] – The '''[[Medal of Honor]]''', the highest military decoration awarded by the [[Federal government of the United States|United States government]], was first authorized by the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]]. {{*mp}} [[1917]] – Vigilantes '''[[Bisbee Deportation|forcibly deported]]''' about 1,300 striking mine workers, their supporters, and innocent bystanders from [[Bisbee, Arizona]], US, to [[New Mexico]]. {{*mp}} [[1943]] – [[World War II]]: German and Soviet forces engaged each other at the '''[[Battle of Prokhorovka]]''', one of the largest tank battles in military history. {{*mp}} [[1967]] – [[Race riot]]s '''[[1967 Newark riots|began]]''' in [[Newark, New Jersey]], leading to 27 deaths in four days. {{*mp}} [[1971]] – The '''[[Australian Aboriginal Flag]]''', one of the official flags of Australia, was flown for the first time. {{*mp}} [[2006]] – [[Hezbollah]] forces crossed the [[Blue Line (Lebanon)|Israel–Lebanon border]] and '''[[2006 Hezbollah cross-border raid|attacked]]''' [[Israel]]i military positions while firing rockets and mortars at Israeli towns, sparking [[2006 Lebanon War|a five-week war]]. {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[July 12]]''': [[List of national independence days|Independence Day]] in '''[[Kiribati]]''' ([[1979]]) and '''[[São Tomé and Príncipe]]''' ([[1975]]); '''[[The Twelfth]]''' in [[Northern Ireland]] <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em;"> [[File:Moscow July 2011-4a.jpg|Saint Basil's Cathedral|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1561]] – '''[[Saint Basil's Cathedral]]''' ''(pictured)'', located at the geographic center of [[Moscow]], was consecrated. {{*mp}} [[1920]] – The '''[[Soviet–Lithuanian Peace Treaty]]''' was signed, with [[Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic|Soviet Russia]] agreeing to recognize an independent Lithuania. {{*mp}} [[1943]] – [[World War II]]: [[Nazi Germany|Nazi German]] and [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] forces engaged each other at the '''[[Battle of Prokhorovka]]''', one of the largest tank battles of all time. {{*mp}} [[1948]] – [[1948 Arab–Israeli War|Arab–Israeli War]]: [[Israeli Defense Force]] officer [[Yitzhak Rabin]] signed the order to '''[[1948 Palestinian exodus from Lydda and Ramle|expel Palestinians]]''' from the towns of [[Lod]] and [[Ramla]].{{*mp}} [[1979]] – Rowdy fans at [[Comiskey Park]] in [[Chicago]] stormed the field during a [[promotion (marketing)|promotional event]] in which a crate of [[disco]] records was '''[[Disco Demolition Night|blown up]]'''. {{*mp}} [[2005]] – '''[[Albert II, Prince of Monaco|Prince Albert II]]''' was enthroned as ruler of [[Monaco]]. </li> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=July|Day=12}} <noinclude> </noinclude>
